channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Hate the Windows 11 Widgets Panel? Here's How to Completely Get Rid of It
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.description: Until Microsoft improves the widget panel, you can disable it completely.
item.content:encoded: The widgets panel on Windows 11 gives you quick access to information like news, weather, stocks, and more. However, I really don't like it, as it takes up a good amount of taskbar space and often interferes with my workflow by popping up unexpectedly. If you also don't find the widgets panel helpful, here's how you can disable it completely.

item.title: I Disabled Windows Startup Apps—Here's How Much Faster My PC Boots
item.dc:creator: Shan Abdul
item.content:encoded: If your device takes ages to boot, and you blame it on its age, you’re mistaken. I used to think the same until I found the real culprit—too many apps loading at startup. Turning off unnecessary apps made my device boot faster. I applied this change on two devices, and here’s the difference it made.

item.title: This Hybrid Became the Benchmark for Longevity
item.dc:creator: Adam Gray
item.description: The first hybrid showed it’s built to last, setting the bar for how tough a car can be.
item.content:encoded: Hybrids might seem tricky with two power sources under the hood, but when done right they’re actually easier to live with than a regular gas car.

item.title: Missing Launchpad in macOS Tahoe? Here 3 Ways to Replace It
item.dc:creator: Andy Betts
item.description: You can't bring Launchpad back, but these are the next best things.
item.content:encoded: One of the main features that was removed from macOS Tahoe was the app launcher, Launchpad. A lot of people didn't use it and won't miss it, but for people like me who used it every day, it's a big loss. Unfortunately, there's no way to bring back Launchpad, but there are other options you can use instead.

item.title: Don't Forget to Change These 5 BIOS Settings When Dual-Booting Windows and Linux
item.dc:creator: Dibakar Ghosh
item.description: Five settings, a couple of minutes, and zero more dual-boot headaches
item.content:encoded: Are you dual-booting Windows and Linux but struggling with a clunky boot process and system conflicts? Wondering why your setup feels less smooth than promised? Well, here are five essential BIOS settings that, when changed, can potentially fix these headaches immediately.

item.title: Don't Be Fooled by the Latest Gimmick in PC Gaming Hardware
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.content:encoded: If you have an ASRock gaming motherboard, chances are it comes with a couple of “Lightning Gaming Ports” on the rear for your mouse and keyboard. A "gaming" USB port sounds fancy, but does it actually do anything, or is it just another USB gimmick?

item.title: Fixing Excel Datasets With Multiple Header Rows Is Easier Than You Think
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Sort out your confusing Excel dataset in just a few steps.
item.content:encoded: Column headers in Excel datasets provide context for the data in each column, making the information easier to read and understand. However, column headers spanning two or more rows can cause problems. Luckily, Power Query can help you fix this.

item.title: Why Brave Convinced Me to Finally Stop Using Chrome
item.dc:creator: Aran Folsom
item.description: Change can be scary. It's time to be Brave.
item.content:encoded: I've been a loyal fan of Google since Chrome's lightning-fast speed and minimalist design saved us from Internet Explorer in 2008. With the release of Gmail, Google Docs, and the rest of the apps that make up what is now Google Workspace, Google began managing every aspect of my online life.

item.title: Why You Shouldn’t Use a Full Path in Your Linux Aliases
item.dc:creator: Bobby Jack
item.description: Keep your aliases short and sweet.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes, you may see advice that suggests using full paths in your aliases. Stop a moment. Is that really the behavior you want, and how can you even decide?

item.title: 5 Weird Products That Run on Power Tool Batteries
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Did you know power tool brands make these wild products?
item.content:encoded: Being equipped with the proper tools can make any DIY job or construction project easier and more effective, but sometimes the tool you need is one you never knew existed. Many of you have a cordless drill, sawzall, and other random tools, but did you know your favorite brand also makes things like a battery-powered Tig welder or coffee machine for a fresh cup on the job site?
